Package datastructure

Class FeatureEntry

java.lang.Object
datastructure.Feature
public final class FeatureEntry
extends java.lang.Object
Internal representation of a reference sequence location that is subject to analysis. May represent the full genome, a single gene, contigs or plasmids and chromosomes.

Pairs of instances of this class and SampleEntry instances are used internally as so called 'Run entries' to specify a set of analysis tasks, i.e. which sample is analyzed with respect to which specified reference feature.

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.1
Author:
Simon Hackl

    AllocatedProteinEntry allocatedProtein
    A AllocatedProteinEntry object containing information about the reference protein structure of the possible protein product of the gene represented by this FeatureEntry and all discovered proteoforms.

    A HashMap yielding any meta-information String key-value pairs about this FeatureEntry.
    java.lang.String chromosome
    The location of the entry on the reference, i.e. for genes the contig or chromosome the feature is located on.
    int end
    The 1-based indexed end position of the feature.
    boolean isSense
    Indicates if the feature is located on the sense strand.
    java.lang.String name
    The internal name of the entry.
    java.lang.String nucleotideSequence
    The reference DNA sequence of the entry.
    java.io.File pdbFile
    A File object pointing to a .pdb format file containing the protein structure information of allocatedProtein.
    int start
    The 1-based indexed starting position of the feature.

  • Constructor Details

    • FeatureEntry

      public FeatureEntry​(java.lang.String entryName, java.lang.String entryLocation, int entryStart, int entryEnd) throws MusialBioException
      Constructor of FeatureEntry.
      Parameters:
      entryName - String representing the internal name of the reference feature to analyze.
      entryLocation - String the name of the reference location (contig, chromosome, plasmid) the feature is located on.
      entryStart - Integer The 1-based indexed starting position of the feature on the reference.
      entryEnd - Integer The 1-based indexed end position of the feature on the reference.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If the specified locus is ambiguous.

  • Method Details

    • imputeSequence

      public static void imputeSequence​(FeatureEntry feature, FastaContainer referenceSequence)
      Method to add the nucleotide sequence to any FeatureEntry.
      Parameters:
      feature - The FeatureEntry to which nucleotide sequence information shall be added.
      referenceSequence - FastaContainer representation of the parent/reference sequence, i.e. reference genome or genome assembly.

    • imputeProtein

      public static void imputeProtein​(FeatureEntry feature) throws java.io.IOException, MusialBioException
      Method to add the protein wild-type information to any FeatureEntry.

      The specified FeatureEntry has to specify the pdbFile property.

      - The parsed protein amino-acid sequence is compared with the translated amino-acid sequence of the nucleotideSequence property by pairwise sequence alignment. While the translated sequence is allowed to be longer than the protein sequence, this is not allowed vice versa. - The internally stored allocatedProteins AllocatedProteinEntry.pdb will be matched in terms of residue numbers to the information gained from the alignment, i.e. if the .pdb starts with residue 10, but the sequences align at the beginning the first residue number in the internal .pdb is set to be 1; if the .pdb starts with residue 1, but the sequence (of the protein) has a gap of length 9 at the beginning in the alignment the first residue number in the internal .pdb is set to be 10.

      Parameters:
      feature - The FeatureEntry to which protein information shall be added.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the .pdb file pointed to by the pdbFile can not be parsed.
      MusialBioException - If either the translated nucleotideSequence yields internal termination codons or contains any gaps when aligned to the amino-acid sequence derived from the .pdb fiel.
